page.title: 09ABERDEEN FIRE SERVICE
page.content: The Fire Station on Anderson Drive is responsible for fire fighting and prevention for a large part of Aberdeen. The area under its jurisdiction stretches from the Bridge of Dee in the Southright out to Daestone at the Bridge of Don. It also serves part of Bucksburn. There are 270 uniformed staff employed there, organised into 4 watches. Each watch is on duty for 4 turns of 12 hours each week (normally 2 night shifts followed by 2 day shifts). The station has 2 water tenders. 1 foam tender, 1 turntable ladder, 1 lorry for specialised equipment and one canteen vehicle to provide food during a long fire fight. The station has several classrooms for the theoretical training of firemen as well as a gym and games hall for physical training.
